column1: Kata Robata////Was in town visiting from DC area so my expectations for the Houston dining scene were a bit low.  Kata Robata was the real deal.  I read that one of the chefs (Manabu Horiuchi)
column2: was a James Beard semi-finalist so that's cool.  Despite coming on a Sunday evening (typically not the best days typically for sashimi)
column3: everything was super fresh.  The Amaebi was awesome and the heads were fried to perfection.  Ikura and hotate were also super fresh. The grilled squid was really tasty and a huge portion.  The only disappointment was that they were completely out of Uni and there were several dishes that eemed like standouts that had uni.  All in all
column4: solid place for high quality sashimi and robatayaki - and I'm sure the other dishes are worth trying.
